channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Slovakian Charged in Shooting ‘Was Against Everything’
item.description: People who know the suspect described a “weird and angry” loner who wrote erotic poetry, and whose resentments ranged across the political spectrum.

item.title: Slovakian Charged in Shooting ‘Was Against Everything’
item.description: People who know the suspect described a “weird and angry” loner who wrote erotic poetry, and whose resentments ranged across the political spectrum.

item.title: Electric mobility has 'won the race' but Volkswagen hits brakes on EV strategy
item.description: The automaker is selling so many combustion engine cars that it’s on track to overshoot its emissions allowance for next year.

item.title: Protesters at University of Chicago Take Over Institute of Politics Building
item.description: They confronted the institute’s director, the former senator Heidi Heitkamp. At the University of Pennsylvania, demonstrators also tried to occupy a building.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Recovers the Bodies of Three Hostages Taken on Oct. 7
item.description: The three were attending the Tribe of Nova trance music festival when they disappeared. Their bodies were found by the Israeli military during an overnight operation.

item.title: Debt-hungry Americans focking to Europe as interest rate cuts fuel $33bn 'Reverse Yankee'
item.description: Issuance of European debt could be on track to break records as the Eurozone gets the jump against the Fed in cutting rates.

item.title: Being Muslim in Modi’s India
item.description: Families grapple with anguish and isolation as they try to raise their children in a country that increasingly questions their very identity.

item.title: Being Muslim in Modi’s India
item.description: Families grapple with anguish and isolation as they try to raise their children in a country that increasingly questions their very identity.

item.title: Wealthy travelers seeking sun, sand, and luxury are flocking to the Caribbean paradise next to Haiti, where armed gangs dominate
item.description: Even Fast & Furious star Vin Diesel wants to build a movie studio there.

item.title: A Would-be Assassin Stirs Europe’s Violent Ghosts
item.description: Political violence and polarization stalk Europe today, with ominous echoes of the past.

item.title: A Would-be Assassin Stirs Europe’s Violent Ghosts
item.description: Political violence and polarization stalk Europe today, with ominous echoes of the past.

item.title: This is the best time of day to exercise for people living with obesity, new study shows
item.description: One hormone in particular may explain the health benefits of physical activity at this time.

item.title: Biden’s China Tariffs Are the End of an Era for Cheap Chinese Goods
item.description: The president’s move to protect strategic manufacturing sectors from low-cost competition aims to increase jobs, but consumers might not like the costs.

item.title: When a Tale of Migration Is Not Just Fiction
item.description: When the director and crew of “Io Capitano” toured Senegal with their acclaimed movie, audiences responded with their life stories.

item.title: World's largest asset manager wants Fed to reverse course: Slash rates to tame inflation
item.description: Rick Rieder, BlackRock’s chief investment officer of global fixed income, oversees about $2.4 trillion in investments.
